attributes.action: Ensure any partygate fines will be made public
attributes.additional_details: It is in the national interest that any fines issued by the metropolitan police should be made public. The government should be transparent in this process and let the people know if our elected leaders have broken any rules.
attributes.background: The government should be transparent with the findings of the police investigation into parties at and around Downing Street. The results of the investigation and any fines issued should be made public.

rejection.details: Decisions about investigating alleged offences and publishing the results of this investigation are a matter for the police and Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or Parliament.
